title: Blockchain Certificates Assertion Schema, Version 1.2.0
description: Extends the Open Badges Assertion Schema for certificates on the blockchain

JsonLdType.description: A type or an array of types that the assertion object represents. The first or only item should be 'Assertion', and any others should each be an IRI (usually a URL) corresponding to a definition of the type itself. In almost all cases, there will be only one type: 'Assertion'

ImageBase64.description: A base-64 encoded png image of the issuer's logo.

id.description: URI that links to the certificate on the viewer. Default is https://[domain]/[uid]

uid.description: Unique identifier, in GUID format. 1.2.0 changes: string pattern changed to guid

issuedOn.description: Date the the certificate JSON was created.

evidence.description: Text, uri, etc. that shows evidence of the recipient's learning that the certificate represents. Can be left as an empty string if not used.

expires.description: Date the the certificate JSON expires.

image:signature.description: A base-64 encoded png image of the issuer's signature.
